subtitle: Hello, I'm Jeffrey Mishlove. You may have
noticed that I'm including more silence
in these “In Presence” monologues now.
What I'm doing in that silence is a
variety of things. There are so many ideas in
my mind, thousands of threads that I
could draw on to share with you and I'm
kind of drawing on them inwardly.
Also, a few segments ago I mentioned that
notion of spiritual transmissions. it
occurs to me that spiritual transmission
isn't about the words I use. It's almost
about the vibration in between the words,
but I thought maybe a few moments of
silence perhaps before and after these
monologues might help to create a space
for that transmission to occur. Now, I'd
like to talk about the concept of
entelechy. As I understand it, the concept
is a reference to purpose, to your unique
purpose. Why were you born? Why are you on
this planet now? What's going on here? I mean,
if you were going to be born, you could
have been conceived and born on any
planet at any time or on this
planet at any time and any country, but
you were born in your particular body.
You are you. You are unique. part of
your uniqueness is what Jean Houston, one
of my mentors, refers to as entelechy.
It's an inner purpose in your life.
Many of us are not in touch with our
entelechy or we go in and out of touch
with it. For example, in my case, back in
2004 I was living in Las Vegas, Nevada. We
had been there a few years.
At that time it was kind of,
to be blunt, garbage floating on the
water, that is, whichever way the tides
were going, I was drifting. I didn't have
a clear sense of direction and purpose
at that moment in my life.
Fortunately for me, I'm the kind of
person who pays attention to dreams.
Dreams have been one of the major
sources of inner guidance in my life.
I had a dream that was very striking on
one occasion. It was one of those dreams
where you wake up and there's a poem. And
the poem was, “When you leap from your
sleep you will get to keep the depths
from the deep.” That was it. When you leave
from your sleep you will get to keep the
depths from the deep, meaning getting in
touch with my own inner resources. Well,
the funny thing is that that day that I
awoke from that dream, that very day, I
received an email from a fellow I've
never heard of named Dave Ellis, and he
had a seminar called “Falling Awake."
Somehow I got on his list and he
invited me and said, “We're going to do this
Falling Awake seminar at The Institute
of Noetic Sciences in Novato, California,
and you're invited to attend for free.
” Falling Awake, leap from your sleep, I
thought to myself, “I can't pass that
opportunity up.” As a consequence of
that, I attended that seminar and several
other advanced seminars with Dave Ellis
and his Falling Awake team.
Here's the intriguing thing about it,
so many spiritual programs talk about:
you must let go of all your desires
and attachments. Desires and attachments
are bad. That's what keeps us grounded
here on the Earth.
According to Buddhism, your desires
are the basis of all suffering. Well,
Dave Ellis had the opposite point of
view. He said, “The more desires you have,
the more desirable you are.” The
thrust of the Falling Awake seminar was,
write down all your desires. He handed us
all little like shoe boxes, file boxes,
with three-by-five cards. He said, “You
write down every desire on a separate
three-by-five card and we are going to have,
by the time we're finished, an enormous
file of everything that you want to
accomplish in your life and you're going
to begin to map out how you're going to
get there, how you're going to go from A
to B to C to D, and you are going to be
achieving these desires.” That was what
basically the seminar was about. But it
did have a spiritual basis and they also
taught and still teach, to my knowledge,
life coaching and advanced life coaching.
I took those courses and I'm very
glad. In fact, I even signed up for a year
of life coaching with a fellow named
Richard Kiefer, who was one of Dave
Ellis’ colleagues. Now, an intriguing
thing is I'm probably not the most
materialistic person in the world but
I'm far from the least materialistic
person you'll ever meet either. One
of the Inspirations that came to me as a
result, I think, of engaging in this
process was I decided to get involved in
the Las Vegas real estate market. It
happened to be like perfect timing and I
made a bundle that year, more than I've
ever made any year of my life. I think it
was 2004, just buying and selling real
estate. You see, I may mention
parenthetically, my dad was a
realtor. For a time, in my
undergraduate years in college, I think
it would be the summer of 1968, I worked
selling real estate in Milwaukee,
Wisconsin, for the summer and earned
enough money to cover my whole school
year doing that and plus some, as I
recall.So, now in 2004 I thought I'll
jump back into the market. It looks like
a tempting opportunity. The timing
couldn't have been better for me.
That's really what enabled me to shell
out eventually, I think about $10,000, for
a year's worth of life coaching, which
was a valuable, a good thing to do.
So, there's an example of a couple of
things: synchronicity, messages coming
from dreams, entelechy. I was getting in
touch with my own inner purpose and
sometimes it might seem like a detour.
Like here I am a parapsychologist and a
person in the media, radio and video and
television and what am I doing
buying and selling real estate? But for
me, it was the perfect thing at that time.
You know, life doesn't always follow a
straight path and there may be times
when your entelechy, your deep, inner
purpose is going to take you in an
unexpected direction. That's the point
that I'd like to make: unexpected
direction, something new, something
different. You may find an opportunity to
leap from your sleep to fall awake.
You see, I talked in a previous “In
Presence” segment about the notion that
we go from trance to trance to trance.
That was Adam Crabtree's presentation in
my interview with him. What that
means is, a trance state is where the
mind is highly focused, which is a good
thing. But, because the mind is highly
focused, you're
missing a lot when you go from trance to trance
to trance. There's a lot of things that
your brain will simply filter out, maybe
important things, things that are
relevant and valuable to you, that
you'll miss because you're so focused. So,
sometimes it's useful to soften your
focus. Let yourself be open to anything
that might come your way. You never know.
Now, the focus of these monologues, of
course, is largely parapsychology, but I
wanted to go in any direction because I
know there are, let's say a round number,
a thousand of you watching this video
and each of you is going to have a
separate entelechy. Your inner
superconscious mind is scanning the
environment looking for opportunities.
It's full of knowledge, full of things
your conscious mind isn't aware of.
It may be trying to send a message
up to the conscious mind like, “Pay
attention to this. Pay attention to that.
Don't ignore things.” So, even if you feel
that you’re really in touch with your
deep inner purpose, that in itself can be
a blinder. Like me, here I am doing video,
doing video, every day, every day. What am
I missing as a result of that? I need to
be aware and so do you. I'll leave you
with those thoughts. And once again thank
you for being with me.
